comment: Second time I've taken Dr. Louten; she's still awesome. She's always prepared and the lectures are clear and understandable. She frequently stops the lectures to make sure everyone's following. Homework didn't directly feed into test material but helped with an overall grasp of the field, while the quizzes directly aided preparation for the tests.

Jut a horrible professor all around. It's a hard class and she does nothing to help make it easier. The HW is not helpful and is tedious, her quizzes are not helpful, her tests are the worst. She adds on chapters to tests last minute and goes over one chapter for EVER. EXAMS ARE LIKE EVERY OTHER WEEK! TOO MUCH INFO TO REMEMBER!Needs to be dismissed
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I had her for AMP Bio1107, and she is a great professor who teaches very well. However, through the semester her content gets much much harder. Although I finished with an A, her quizzes got really really hard and she gives you 35 minutes to take a 30 question quiz where the last two questions have 10 parts each. She also gives little extra credit
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: I had her fall 2020 (corona szn) The class is challenging itself but Dr. Louten is amazing at dumbing down tough subjects. She TRULY cares and is willing to help US learn. We had a "Super-Quiz" every 2 weeks but that was bc of 'Rona. She is bubbly and always ready to teach. Don't rely on lectures though! You will not pass without textbook notes!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I believe that Professor Louten is one of the only professors who made the switch to an online format in the middle of the semester as smooth as possible. Both her in-person and online classes were pretty fluid in pacing and she held us to the same standards online as was in person when we did testing. Overall, I thought she was a great professor.

Dr. Louten is so so kind and easy to talk to. She cares so much about all of her students. Virology is difficult and she is lecture heavy. Her slides are posted and they are very organized and her tests are very fair with extra credit. Would totally take again.

Absolutely take her. I've had her for immunology and virology and she's one of the most passionate, charismatic, and caring professors I've ever had. The negative reviewers clearly did something wrong. She really cares about the success of her students and her passion has inspired me to want to pursue immunology as a career.

she was the best teacher's I've had this semester, her class is a little difficult but she helps you succeed in the best way she can. her test are not too difficult, she does give a lot of homework on mastering bio but it does help with tests. overall a great professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Shes changed. Such a tough professor. Had her for virology and barely made it out. And Im an a student. ,
Incredibly difficult professor. Won't curve and doesn'ttest what she teaches. There are much better professors. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Louten is an amazing professor. I 100% recommend taking her. Biology is really hard, but Dr. Louten knows what she's talking about and breaks it down for you. Class is lecture heavy, and the tests are difficult but are based on the notes. GO TO THE SI SESSIONS WITH THE TA BEFORE EVEY TEST and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I loved this class!!! Its super interested but its hard. Its very time consuming. I took his class as a hybrid so we have about an hour and 30 mins videos to watch every week along with in class lectures once a week. You have to watch the videos and listen to her lectures! Once you fall behind its hell to catch up. But its a great class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is extremely passionate about immunology and it's quite infectious. I discovered a passion for the subject during my time in her class and am very glad I took her. Students are graded on tests and various homework assignments throughout the semester. If you are struggling with something, she is very willing to listen and help you to understand.

Absolutely adore her. I knew her prior to the class and she cares about the students. Always advocating office hours or appointments. One online homework site. 4 tests, no final. It is an easy class, just a lot of material to take in. If you follow her advice, you will ace it. There are extra credit opportunities.

I had no interest in virology but Im glad I took it with Dr. Louten. Shes super nice and caring and easy to listen to. The class is straightforward. Homework is easy, test are exactly whats covered and there are a few online quizzes. The presentation work is spaced out and easily done. Completely fair class with a great professor! Got an A
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Best. Professor. Ever. lots of grades: 4 tests (non-cumulative final), hw for each test (does well to prepare you), quizzes, extra credit. This was a hybrid class and her videos on d2L follow along perfectly with the class ppts, very easy to study. You have to work hard for this class, but the info is interesting. favorite class in all of college!!

Dr. Louten is one of the best profs in the bio dept. Tests straightforward, no trick questions. You have to know the material very well but all questions are fair. very helpful during office hours if you're confused. 3 tests + noncumulative final, does not replace a low test grade. periodic quizzes on d2l. lots of hw but is not difficult
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I love Dr. Louten! she is by far the best biology teacher I ever had. I learned so much in her class and lectures. The only homework she gives is mastering Bio which is easy. I used the textbook so that I can understand the concepts better, but her powerpoint cover most of the topics on the test so you'll do well. She's always there for office hrs.

I love this lady, she is the best. she has a nice personality and she's easy to talk to if you have any problem. exam 1 was supper easy, just study the ppt and the online reading but exam 2 and 3 you'll need to come to class every day and read the books and ppt. attendant is mandatory. Her exam are multiple choice, free respond, and acronyms.

In my opinion, best professor at KSU. It's majority lectures with a little bit of MasteringBiology. The PowerPoints that goes with the lecture are great great great! She explain the material so well and always have little acronyms to help you remember things. The test are easy if you follow the study guide. She just one of the best teacher.

She's really nice and doesn't mind stopping the entire lecture to make sure you understand a concept. However, she does not allow extra time for writing notes because she wants you to go back and look at the PowerPoints to study.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Respected

comment: Dr. Louten is by far the best professor I have ever had at KSU. I took her for Bio 1 and loved every second of it. She made lecture so interesting and easy to understand that I was not bored once. She is EXTREMELY helpful outside of class and wants to help you in anyway she can to succeed. I love her so much I am taking her other courses! TAKE HER!

Dr. Louten is amazing for BIO 1107. She is absolutely hilarious, and is amazing at explaining tough concepts. Her "final" is just another exam (thank god lol). Make sure you stay on top of the Mastering Bio HW and you'll do great! Don't bother buying the textbook, I got it and haven't touched it.
Shes a great professor who takes her time to be sure you understand the material, and is very thorough. The exams are not extremely difficult but be sure to study.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: I don't understand the negative posts. She is one of the best professors i've had. She is extremely helpful, prepares video lectures, and see's to it you succeed. I frequently pushed this class off for pchem and made A's off a few hours of study. It's not an "easy" A for everyone, but about as fair as upper level BIO's get.

I took Immunology as an elective and I'm regretting it so much. This is one of the most time consuming classes ever.  Dr. Louten is nice but throws 20 slides at you in the last 10 minutes of class, the day before a test, and expects you to understand it.  Get ready to spend hours and hours a day with her classes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: The BEST Bio professor at SPSU, now KSU. We did partner research papers, and presentations in the class, they werent har but it does take some time. The exams are exactly what she lectures, no twist , no loops so if you dont get the grade you want, it's all on you. Very clear and always willing to help if you need it. Not super easy but its college
Amazing teacher, super nice and sweet. She makes her class interesting and makes us laugh.
Great professor! Class work was easy, labs were fun and we had plenty of time left over so class always ended early. Don't think twice, take Pro. Louten.

Dr. Louten is a fantastic teacher.  I was mildly interested in Biology before this class but I love it now.  She teaching the subject in an exciting and easy to understand way.  The test questions are straight forward and simple if you study.  I also had her for lab, which was a cool class.  You won't regret taking her class!

I have her for bio lab and she's pretty low key. Attendance is mandatory because your grade for the day depends on your lab. No attendance, no lab, no grade. Labs aren't too bad. Some are extremely time consuming. But, she's fair and you'll be fine if you take her.
My course number says BIOL 4903 but it was intro to Bio 1. I love her to death!!! Super nice and makes materials really interesting. Totally recommend her.

Best teacher ever! Very smart, nice, and funny! She is one of the teachers that makes you love the subject even if you didn't have prior interest. Coming in, I really had no interest in science and so I wasn't all that excited to start but after just two weeks in her class now, I LOVE BIOLOGY!!! I gained lots of knowledge from her just in two weeks

The material was boring, but she usually found ways to make it fun and interesting. She also had several clever tips to help remember difficult topics. I would definitely recommend her. The class isn't too difficult, it just covers a lot of material. I never used the textbook.

Dr. Louten is wonderful! I really had no idea what cell and tissue culture was but she made me love it! Now it's what I would want to do the rest of my life. Alot of people say she's easy but that's not it. She just clarifies and teaches very well. Love her!
Just like all upper level bios, this is hard. I got a B. However, I reminisce very fondly about this class. Take it.

Her slides are the key to success in her class...as are the end of chapter questions. Her tests are mostly multiple choice...but not easy if you haven't read the material. You can make an A but you will need to memorize lots of terms so be sure to study a half hour every night...then it will be an easy A!!!!

Dr. Louten is hands down the best science professor I've ever had. Study those powerpoints and handouts that she is so generous to give you and you will pass her class. Shes also very pleasing to the eye. Best looking female Dr. on campus! Would take again definitely.
The best!

She is so smart, fun and witty not to mention super hot! As for the class and her work. Its easy if you study the slides over and over. She rarely uses the book so you can save the $200. I have an A average in her class with no textbook. Her lectures are always fun and did I mention shes HOT! Will take her again for Immunology in my junior year.

I had Dr. Louten for several classes and she has been consistently amazing in all of them. She is helpful, friendly, and super smart. She is also very responsive to emails and questions and her door is always open. Her exams are fair, though there is a lot of material to cover in her classes, so be prepared. Keep up and your grade will be good. :)

She's great! She has the ppt posted before every class. She covers a lot in each class. But she's always willing to help. The labs are easy. Test and quizzes can be a challenge. But if you read over the slides a few times you will do fine. She also post study guides for the test. The final isn't cumulative either. Test cover 3 sections at a time. And you don't need the book.
Dr. Louten is a really great teacher. She is very nice and wants to help her students. She response to all your emails about help. I wish i could take her class for BIO 2.
Awesome Professor! All tests are from the notes and if you show up and study, you'll do well. Louten will know your name and help you if you need any help at all
Dr. Louten is a great teacher and makes any subject interesting. Virology has been a wonderfully exciting class and has opened up other fields of interest in biology to me.
She's awesome! I understand what she teaches, and she's really good about answering questions. Definitely take her if you have the chance (:

dr louten was cool i loved her class her quizzes are ten questions multiple choice real easy. her labs are easy as well. sometimes the test can seem like there is a lot of material but she has lecture slides for each chapter and a study guide. she is a fun and down to earth teacher
Too much material at one time! This class will lower your GPA! Scores as low as possible.

I would take Dr. Louten for biology over again. She was such a wonderful teacher. So helpful, and there to teach and actually help the students. She made the labs fun and had a good personality. Read the study guides she provides and go over the slides and you'll do well. I will miss her class! I'm an English major and don't even like science!

Dr. Louten is AWESOME. I'm not big into Biology, but she certainly makes class fun and interesting. On top of that, she's a really cool lady and even made a point to come to my portfolio show. I definitely recommend her!

I went into her class liking biology and came out loving it. She has changed my life and I'm excited about the path I have decided to trek because of her influence. She's funny, smart and she even has a bicycle!!! You will find she cares about your progress and is extremely personable. Take her for everything you can if you are a bio major.
Wonderful teacher!  Easy tests if you study.  Helps you in lab if there is any confusion.

Dr. Louten is a great professor! Very helpful and makes sure everyone understands the topics covered in class. Study guides are given for tests and she makes lab fun. Workload is fair and like mentioned she is always there to help. Recommend taking her classes you will learn a lot!
